captions.text: [CAR ENGINE REVVING]
[MUSIC PLAYING]
My name's Dylan Murry.
I am 12 years old.
I turned 12 on September 17.
I race Go Karts and Legends.

I've been racing for a couple
years, probably about four.

I started off racing karts at
a place called Andretti.

After that, I'm about to start
Legends, and I hope that will
go well for me.
[CAR ENGINE]
[MUSIC PLAYING]

I like how there's a lot
of competition in it.

Legends, I think it would be
awesome because of how
competitive the series are.

Every series I've raced in
is pretty competitive.
[MUSIC PLAYING]

I would say I'm pretty good
at starting in the back.

When you start in the back of a
pack, you just have to fall

behind and just gas it before
everybody else.

You just have to take
risks on the start.
[CAR ENGINE ROARING]

I really like it because there's
people surrounding you
everywhere.

It's really a challenge for you
to get around that pack
and take the lead.
I don't think it's that scary.
I think it's pretty awesome.
[CAR ENGINE ROARING]

Oh, I'd love to get my
driver's license.

I've been dying for it
ever since I was
seven, I would say.
[CAR ENGINE ROARING]

When I was about two or three,
I got this little
tricycle for Christmas.

And I always pedaled as fast
as I could, and my dad just

kicked the back around
to steer it.

So I was always doing stunts
and going fast
ever since I was born.
[CAR ENGINE ROARING]

I wasn't really much into
any other stuff.

I mean, I'm not that into
playing sports.

But I still play sports,
but I'm not as
interested in those as racing.
I really love racing.

That's my favorite
thing to do.
[MUSIC PLAYING]

title: GYMKHANA Jr. - The Fastest 12 Year Old in the World - /DRIVEN

comments.author: KYoss68

comments.text:
True. The logistics of racing can add up in a hurry. That being, legends 
are not much more costly than kart racing. Tires are dirt cheap, they run 
on regular unleaded and they are smaller than an original Mini. Racing is 
never Free. But this is affordable on a very tight budget.
comments.author: pegalis

comments.text:
If only it were so simple. Even after you save enough to buy a car "by 
mowing lawns" the day to day costs of racing are way more than most 
families can handle. You need a trailer to get the car to the track, a 
place to keep the car and trailer at your house, money for gas, parts, 
entry fees, etc, etc. It's hard to imagine a more expensive sport for a 
kid.
comments.author: gotham61

comments.text:
FYI to all you haters saying "If only my parents were rich" A used legends 
car can be had for only $4k. As a kid, you can save that up mowing lawns. 
ALLOT of lawns :D
